alert.note: Alert for Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 5:17PM CDT until May 20 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River near Sweeny. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Lazy G RV Boat Ramp takes on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 7.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 5.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise above flood stage again late Thursday morning to 7.9 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 12/14/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River Sweeny 7.0 6.3 Tue 4 pm CDT 5.8 7.7 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1130 AM CDT.
